113212.content:
Yes, you had always loved fantasy games as well as novels on the like, so why not remake the world in that image? You thought about a world filled with magic and monsters, ruins and other places to explore, and adventurers mingling with people that remained closer to home. There’s no telling what fun you could have in a world like that. You focused on it, and willed the stone to make it so. The heartbeat and warming sensations were stronger this time, making it feel like the emerald was almost alive in your hand.

The effect came to a crescendo as the world around you started to glow and smear. Before long, it felt like you were inside an enormous lava lamp. The strange view stopped in an instant, leaving you in a dark void.

A brief moment of panic swelled in your chest. Had something gone wrong, had the stone misinterpreted something about your wish? Then a booming voice came out of the darkness.

“Greetings adventurer, your journey is about to begin. But before you start, you must decide who you will be. Will you be a mighty warrior, skilled in combat and taking the fight to your foes?” As the voice spoke, a spotlight blazed out and illuminated a mannequin dressed in heavy armor and carrying a sword and shield. “On the other hand, might you prefer stealth and striking from range as a rogue?” A second spotlight showed another mannequin dressed in leather armor and carrying a dagger and a bow. “Lastly, there is also the option of being a mage, drawing on magic and destroying those that stand before you with the elements, or weakening them with more subtle means and even supporting your allies with your magical arts.” A third spotlight showed a robed mannequin wielding a magical staff. “Choose wisely adventurer, for your choice will define much about yourself. Do note that there may be ways to expand on your talents and perhaps even combine your choice with those that you did not, but you will have to find these possibilities on your own.”

With that, the voice went silent, leaving you alone with the illuminated mannequins as your only company in the dark expanse. You looked back and forth between the three choices, your mind sorting through all the choices you had made in previous situations. This felt different though since it was going to be your life, not just that of your character on a screen or paper.

After what felt like an eternity, you made your choice and moved towards the class you wanted. You stepped forward—though it felt more than a little strange stepping on and through nothing—moving towards the mannequin.

Adam's mother was waiting by the door as he entered.

"Where have you been?" she asked him angrily.

"I was at the park. I have someth.."

Adam's mother cut him off. "You were at the park? You went there without telling me?"

Adam was cowed. "Yes, Mommy." He hung his head down in shame.

"How many times have I told you. Don't leave the house without me or Daddy?"

"It was just that." Adam wanted to explain.

Adam's mother was treating him like a small child since he had the personality of a seven year old. He didn't know to look both ways when crossing the street nor not to talk with strangers and all that stuff. She was just looking out for him. Ever since he made the swap with the little girl, his mother became worried that she didn't know where he was.

"It's nothing. I'll have to punish you. Go to your room and wait for me."

"Yes, Mommy."

Adam's mother was relieved that he was home. She didn't want to punish him, but he wasn't mature enough to be outside without adult supervision. She'll call his dad and decide what to do. Excitedly, you show them your new find, turning the ring around like a magician playing with a coin. Scott is his usual mercenary self, "Is it valuable? Do you know if that's real gold?"

Dave is less interested, "Is that womans ring, or a mans, Adam?"

Stopping your games, you hold it closer, examining it. You don't know the answer to Adam's question. While it's quite plain, with only some simple celtic engravings wrapping around the surface, suggesting to you it's for a man. It's also quite slim, and elegant making you think it's for a woman.

More from curiosity than real interest, you slip the ring on. Perhaps, it can a present from yourself for getting into university. Slipping it on your finger, your thoughts wander. How you'll get on a university, who you'll meet, and so forth.

But those thoughts are scatted, as the ring slides into place. As the breeze seems to quicken. But it wasn't the wind that changed, it was yourself. Your clothes, are gone in their place a bikini. You're wearing a bikini! Worse yet, you fit it!

Glancing to your friends, they too are wearing only bikinis. But both Scott and Dave are continuing chattering away. Their conversation uninterrupted by their sudden switch in gender. Around your slender finger, the ring pulses warmly, guiltily. Keeping quiet, you keep walking, the hot sand beneath your bare feet.

1511.content: Adam is walking home alone. He thinks to himself about how bored he is with his life. But then someone bumps into him. He couldn’t tell who it was, except for a fedora and a black trench coat. Adam then notices something, a notebook. He looks over to tell the man he dropped something, but the man is gone. He looks at the cover and it says RAID: a Reality Altering Interface Device. He opens the notebook, but only finds a series of a instructions in 12 languages. Adam becomes curious and thinks that if the guy figures out he dropped it, then he could just buy another notebook. Adam decides to take it home with him. When he arrives, he heads straight for his bedroom and starts reading the instructions. He decides that he should write something to test it, but he has no idea what to write about. He decides to write down either a couple from next door who have been trying for five years to conceive to finally be successful (Helper Path-Meaning that Adam will devote the notebook to helping good people in need of godly aide), use it on the bullies of school and turn them into the nerds, fat people, and gays (Attacker Path-Meaning that Adam will devote the notebook to attacking the people he perceives as evil), or summon the trenchcoat guy or maybe call of friend (Assist Path-whether it’s a friend that wasn’t listed on the previous chapter or the Watcher, Adam will not be the only one with the powers of the notebook).

1512.content:
Another boring day at the college. Adam sighs at that feels like a dull succession of slow days, mecanically following a daily habit, especially since he doesn't have much friends to begin with, given he's actually a shy boy.
To pass the time, when he didn't had homework to do, the boy liked to draw fantasical universes, imagining being part of some kind of universe where he'd be the hero that fend off monsters and save the day, and, given he didn't had much going on, work-wise, he was idly walking toward home, without really paying attention to its surrounding.

A mysterious man in a black trenchcoat and a fedora was standing there, seemingly scribbling something onto a notebook, before Adam inadvertly bump into him. With a blush, Adam excuse himself, and was about to continue on its way, before the man actually give the notebook to him. For some reasons, Adam accepted it, but before he could ask him about anything, the man wasn't here anymore.

Feeling uneasy about the man's sudden disparition, and scared of being kidnapped and/or harmed, Adam rushes back at his home, half curious of wanting why he got the notebook, and browsing it might give hints of who was the man.

Back at home, he hurriedly goes in his room. On the notebook's cover is written "RAID: Reality Altering Interface Device". A strange title, especially there is nothing else on it. You open it. On the first page is written:

"This artefact has the power of bending and changing the reality as you currently know. DO NOT let in fall in wrong hands.

Rules:
1- Any phrase which contain the words 'wish', 'need' or 'want' will cause the reality to change to fit the phrase as a rule and/or a true fact.
2- Writing a set time on a phrase will allow for it to remain, until the cooldown is off. Then it will be automatically erased.
3- Erasing a phrase will cancel all the effects that occured in reality.
4- You can't harm or kill yourself in any manner through direct or indirect means caused by the notebook. UNLESS YOU AREN'T THE OWNER OF THE BOOK ANYMORE. You've been warned.
5- Telling someone about the notebook's effects and/or powers will cause the person to be aware of the reality change, if applicable/noticeable.
6- Writing 'Reset' in the notebook will erase all the content, aside from the intro and rules.
7- The notebook's size can be changed. So can be the writings in it, aside from thoses mentionned in 6. Also the rules of ot can't be changed in any way.
"

A small note is also written..: 'Don't abuse of its powers. People have been seeking it for long.'. You notice that the rest of the notebook is blank.

15121.content:
You laugh softly. You couldn't believe that the notebook could have any special powers, let alone to change the world! Nethertheless, you liked the attention. It had brightened your day. As a test, you write up, 'I'd wish my best friend is a friendly white feral dragon that i can understand and whose big belly is comfy do i could sleep on it.'. It is childish, and you doubt that it'd become true, but you couldn't be helped but to hope that your parents would read it, so they'd buy you a dragon plush, and maybe be in an happy family again.
The rest of the day was uneventful, if you exclude that looming shadow that you spotted through a window. Given nothing special was in sight, you shrug it off, eventually going to bed.

As you sleep, you start to dream: A gentle, huge, scaled and clawed hand open one of the window of your room, so it could grab you. Outside, it was still night. Yet, you could see that it was a large dragon, white of skin, a size of 60 ft tall and 200 ft long, tail included, and bolstering a large, plushy belly. It gently headrubs you, before it lays down on the ground, rather heavily, neatly placing you between its tail and belly. It yawns and closes its eyes, before your mind drift off away in more dreams.

You wake up and stretch, before getting your hands onto your bed, thinking about what happened yesterday, when you notice you weren't in your bed anymore. You hurriedly get off your makeshift bed, before you trip onto the ground. Thankfully, you didn't get wounded, but the fall was painful enough to make you notice that you weren't dreaming anymore. As your peer up, you also notice that the dragon, just waking up, is as real as you are. It yawns, then it nuzzles you. You smile and rub its snout gently.
Then you notice the notebook. For some reasons, you had brung it with you, making you wonder what to do.

You could explore around with your new friend, eventually getting to know it better, and maybe change it a bit with the notebook. It wouldn't necessary stop you from going into the college nor having a normal life, if only to know what changed.
Out of curiosity, you could also try that, while becoming/swapping of body with the dragon, or as being its mate.

Or you could 'reset' the notebook, to start fresh. Or merely make the dragon less invasive, and try the notebook again.
